Data Transformation Overview (image by author from www.visual-design.net)

Data transformation is the process of converting raw data into a format or
structure that would be more suitable for model building and also data
discovery in general. It is an imperative step in feature engineering that
facilitates discovering insights. This article will cover techniques of
numeric data transformation: log transformation, clipping methods, and data
scaling.

 **Why need data transformation?**

  * the algorithm is more likely to be biased when the data distribution is skewed
  * transforming data into the same scale allows the algorithm to compare the relative relationship between data points better

 **When to apply data transformation**

When implementing supervised algorithms, training data and testing data need
to be transformed in the same way. This is usually achieved by feeding the
training dataset to building the data transformation algorithm and then apply
that algorithm to the test set.
